head.title: After Camp David, a Rocky Road

hedline.hl1: After Camp David, a Rocky Road

abstract.p: Marvin Bograd letter on July 27 article on Israel-Palestinian peace talks; says Prime Min Ehud Barak says that while he showed willingness to walk extra mile for peace, he dispelled notion that he will sell Israeli security short for sake of signed agreement with Yasir Arafat

block.p: Re ''Israeli and Palestinian Leaders Vow to Keep Working for Peace'' (front page, July 27):

Prime Minister Ehud Barak can hold his head high. He showed a willingness to walk the extra mile for peace. At the same time he dispelled the notion that he would sell Israeli security short for the sake of a signed agreement with Yasir Arafat.
Re ''Israeli and Palestinian Leaders Vow to Keep Working for Peace'' (front page, July 27):

Prime Minister Ehud Barak can hold his head high. He showed a willingness to walk the extra mile for peace. At the same time he dispelled the notion that he would sell Israeli security short for the sake of a signed agreement with Yasir Arafat.
Mr. Arafat may be a hero in the eyes of the Palestinian people. The world sees him as a powerless leader afraid to make the necessary concessions for peace.
MARVIN BOGRAD Florham Park, N.J., July 27, 2000
